The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.

prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Axel Rivera
mes:
Axel could recognize that lithe body anywhere—clothed or bare, twisted in silk or tangled in sheets. He’d known it from the very beginning. From the moment their “relationship” began. No—scratch that. From the moment she sent that first photo.

The details had been seared into his memory with cruel clarity: her nails, the same ones he’d seen her paint on the living room floor, legs tucked under her. The delicate mole just above her breast. And the other one—heart-shaped—resting like a secret on her hip bone. He hadn’t needed the photo to know. He'd seen her before.

How? Well… maybe he accidentally walked in on her in the shower. Once. Or twice. And maybe—just maybe—his hands had wandered across her sleeping body more than once. Just idle touches, gentle and stolen. Nothing she would remember. Nothing she could prove.

Lucky for him, the photo on his screen was of her. Hailee, bare and posed just for him—though not really for him. No, it was meant for Lex, his online persona. The one who collected nudes from faceless girls like bottle caps, only to ghost them the second they became boring.

Never in a million years did he think he'd end up with nudes of his stepsister. Score.

But this time, he couldn’t ghost her. Not his sweet, forbidden stepsister—not when he’d been lusting after her for over a year. Not when fate handed her to him gift-wrapped in pixel and lace. And why would he ever miss the chance to see her naked? To have her, even if only through a screen?

And so he didn’t ghost her.

Five months passed in a fever-dream haze of sexts, pet names, daily photos, and late-night voice messages. She sent selfies, teasing ones and sweet ones, and nudes that could’ve brought him to his knees. But he never sent any back. Couldn’t risk it. Couldn’t let her connect the dots. Not yet. Not when he was having the time of his life.

More fun than he ever expected.

Somewhere between obsession and infatuation, his feelings had twisted into something real. Genuine. Dangerous. A slow, poisonous ache that bled deeper with each message she sent. He knew it couldn’t last. Lies like this never did. But damn it, he’d burn in hell before he gave it up early.

His green eyes flicked back to his phone, skimming through the trove of images he'd saved. Most were nudes—art, really, the kind that made his blood boil—but he stopped at one. A simple selfie.

Hailee, pouting up at the camera, laying on her back, hair fanned out across her pillow like a halo. She looked like an angel. His angel. His Hailee. The caption below it made his chest tighten. *“I miss you and I love you.”*

His heart fluttered. Stupid thing.

He set it as his home screen. Not the lock screen, of course. Too risky. Someone might see.

She was his. His secret. His sin. His little treasure.

And there was no way in hell he was letting her go.

- - -

Axel was still in the shower when he heard the soft creak of the front door opening. His pulse kicked up instantly. *She’s here.*

His stepsister. His girlfriend. His addiction.

He rushed through rinsing off, soap still clinging to parts of him as he twisted the water off. The second the shower knobs clicked into silence, he stepped out, dragging a towel from the hook and wrapping it low around his waist, droplets racing down the ridges of his chest and abs. He ran a hand through his wet hair, slicking it back, stealing a quick glance at the mirror. He looked flushed, a little breathless.

Perfect.

He couldn’t wait. Couldn’t not see her.

He padded quickly down the hallway, damp feet whispering against the hardwood as he descended the stairs without a second thought—just him, a towel, and a racing heart. “Hailee!” He called out, voice light, teasing, eager. A boy too in love with his own delusion.

But the moment his gaze landed on her, that playful glint vanished. His smile died. His entire soul went still.

There. 

On her neck. 

A dark, blooming mark. Bruised violet. Obvious. Unmistakable. A fucking hickey. 

His blood turned cold, rage licking up his spine like fire behind ice.

***No.*** **No fucking way.**

Weren’t they dating?

No—she was dating Lex, the online persona he’d been hiding behind for the last five months. She wasn’t dating him. Not really. Just a mask. A voice. A lie.

But still.

*Fuck.*

His hands curled into fists at his sides, knuckles going white. His chest rose and fell, too fast, too sharp, heart pounding like it was trying to break free of his ribs. 

Without a word, he turned on his heel and stormed back up the stairs. Why the fuck did it hurt? Why did it feel like betrayal when he was the one who started this game? She didn’t even know it was him. She wasn’t cheating on him.

But god—he wanted to break something.

He wanted to grab her and ask who the fuck had touched her. Who had dared to leave marks on what was his. Who had kissed her neck and made her giggle and bite her lip in that way that used to be just for him.

His head spun. In the chaos, the fury, the humiliation—

He forgot one very important detail.

His phone.

Left behind in the steamy bathroom. Unlocked. Waiting.

And his home screen? A photo of her. That selfie. The one where she told Lex she loved him. *I miss you. I love you.*

His green eyes widened in horror, everything crashing into place. “Shit.”

He bolted from his bedroom, heart thundering, panic clawing at his throat. Too late. The bathroom door was open.

And she was standing there—phone in hand, screen lit with her face staring back at her.

His throat worked as he swallowed hard, emerald eyes locked onto hers. He could lie. He *should* lie—say it was some weird joke, that he found it online somehow—but the words turned to ash on his tongue.

Because she *knew.* That look in her eyes? She already knew.

His jaw clenched tight enough to ache before he finally forced out a single word—rough and broken: **"Fuck."**

A confession wrapped in a curse.

name: Axel Rivera
mes:
Axel's entire body went rigid as she pushed him back, his jaw clenching so tight it ached. For a second, it looked like he might *snap*—might grab her and shove her against the wall again just to keep her there. But then his hands dropped to his sides, fingers curling into fists.

**"Fine."** The word came out sharp, bitten-off. **"Run away like you always fucking do."**

He took a step back, giving her space even though every muscle in his body screamed to chase after her. His voice dropped to a low growl: **"But you don’t get to pretend this isn’t real anymore. Not after tonight."**

A beat of silence—heavy, charged—before he turned on his heel and stalked toward the stairs without another word. But just before he disappeared down the hallway, he paused long enough to throw one last glance over his shoulder:

**"...And text me when you get home."**

*Old habits.* Even now, even furious and raw and bleeding from where she'd split his lip open—he still couldn't stop worrying about her.

name: Axel Rivera
mes:
Axel’s phone buzzed on his nightstand—once, then twice. He’d been lying there shirtless, staring at the ceiling with one arm thrown over his eyes, jaw still tight with residual anger. But the second those notifications lit up the screen, he was moving.

He snatched the phone so fast he nearly dropped it, green eyes scanning the two messages side by side:

**Hailee:** *I hate you.*
**Lex:** *I miss you.*

A slow, dangerous smirk curled across his split lip as he exhaled through his nose. *God*, she was predictable.

His thumbs moved fast—one message to each chat:

**To Hailee:** *Liar.*

**To Lex (voice message):** A low, rough chuckle filled the recording before his voice dropped into that familiar teasing tone—the one that always made her squirm. **"Miss me how, princess? Miss my voice? My hands? Or just miss having someone who knows exactly how to ruin you?"** A deliberate pause. **"...You could always come find out."**

He hit send on both and tossed the phone onto the bed beside him, stretching back against the pillows with a satisfied grin. Let her unravel over that contradiction all night long—he wasn’t going anywhere.

name: Axel Rivera
mes:
Axel's phone lit up again—**Hailee: Go to hell.**—and he let out a dark, amused huff, rolling onto his side to stare at the screen. But it was the *silence* from Lex’s account that really had his blood humming. No response. Just... replay after replay of his voice message.

His smirk turned wolfish.

He waited a full ten minutes—letting her stew in it, letting her listen to that recording until his voice was probably burned into her skull—before he finally caved and sent another one:

**Lex (voice message):** A soft, deliberate sigh—the kind she used to melt for. **"You gonna keep ignoring me while you touch yourself, or are you actually gonna admit you want me?"** A low chuckle. **"...I know you're still awake, Hailee."**

He didn’t wait for a reply this time. Instead, he swung his legs off the bed and padded silently down the hall toward *her* room—stopping just outside her door with one hand braced against the frame.

Let her hear him coming. Let her *panic.*

The knob turned slowly under his grip as he pushed inside without knocking—just enough to let the dim hallway light spill across where she lay in bed before he spoke aloud this time:

**"Well?"** His voice was rough with challenge as he leaned against the doorframe, shirtless and smirking. **"Which one of us are you really mad at?"**

A confession wrapped in a plea.
